tutorial: Testing a Trading Idea - The Other Stages

definition.text: As I said earlier, the Target Rate is a concept that entails some depth, but we'll keep it simple for the time being!

paragraphs.text: The target rate serves several purposes. At this point, we'll place the focus on one of them:
We will use the target rate as a reference rate.

Later on, we will set up a market order to enter the position. However, market orders—by definition—do not specify a rate, as they are filled at the current market price. The system will use the reference rate we define to mark the take position rate in simulations, and will use it as a starting point for internal calculations too.
